thread.title: Dixons Carphone teams up with mobile network Sprint to open US stores
thread.title_full: Dixons Carphone teams up with mobile network Sprint to open US stores

title: Dixons Carphone teams up with mobile network Sprint to open US stores
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 2, 2015, 10:53 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 37 mins Dixons Carphone teams up with mobile network Sprint to open US stores By Jon Yeomans | Telegraph – 2 hours 0 minutes ago 0.06 0.00 
The companies will open 20 US-based sites at first, ahead of a potential rollout of some 500 stores 
Dixons Carphone (LSE: DC.L - news ) is venturing stateside by teaming up with US network Sprint to open 20 retail stores, in the first stage of a partnership that could extend to 500 sites. 
Under the deal, announced this morning, Dixons Carphone’s Connected World Services division will open and manage the Sprint-branded stores, lending its retail expertise to the US carrier, which has 57 million mobile phone customers in the US. 
If successful, the rollout could be extended to 500 stores nationwide, with CWS investing $32m (£20.5m) to acquire 50pc of the joint venture and fund the second phase. 
"This is a very exciting venture for us, and is a significant step in growing our CWS business in the US,” said Andrew Harrison, deputy chief of Dixons Carphone and chief executive of CWS. “We bring specialist knowledge and skills to this partnership and will be looking to deliver innovation and outstanding customer service under the Sprint brand." 
Marcelo Claure, Sprint's chief executive, said: “We are excited to partner with Dixons Carphone and to leverage all their know-how as one of the world's leading wireless retailers to benefit Sprint and its customers. We are committed to offering the best customer experience when buying wireless products and services.” 
Dixons Carphone was formed last August from the merger of Carphone Warehouse and Dixons Retail . Its brands include Carphone Warehouse, Currys and PC World in the UK, and Elkjøp and Phone House across Europe, where it has 2,900 stores. 
Sprint Corporation , the third largest network operator in the US, has been seeking to expand its retail presence. Earlier this year it opened Sprint concessions at 1,435 RadioShack (Other OTC: RSHCQ - news ) stores across the US.
